headline: No Vote Held on Infrastructure, but Talks to Resume
description: WASHINGTON — Despite a long night of frantic negotiations, Democrats were unable late Sept. 30 to reach an immediate deal to salvage President Joe Biden’s $3.5 trillion government overhaul, forcing leaders to call off promised votes on a related infrastructure bill. Action is to resume Oct. 1.

headline: TT Newsmakers
description: Sgt. Zach Heard, Illinois State Police, and Kendis Paris, co-founder and executive director of Truckers Against Trafficking, join TT's Dan Ronan to discuss the cycle of human trafficking and the role trucking can play in the service of public safety. Reserve your seat now.

headline: ATRI Report Urges Electric Tax to Help Fund Highway Repairs
description: A new report from the American Transportation Research Institute suggests that a small tax on electricity used specifically for transportation would produce much-needed support for the federal Highway Trust Fund, revenue from which pays for work on the nation’s roads and bridges.

headline: Transportation Stakeholders Press Congress on $1 Trillion Infrastructure Bill
description: To guarantee long-term funding for the country’s freight and passenger mobility systems, transportation stakeholders are urging Congress to pass a $1 trillion infrastructure measure.

headline: Congress Clears Government Funding Bill to Avert Shutdown
description: The House passed a nine-week spending bill to avert a U.S. government shutdown hours before it was set to begin on an 254-175 vote. The legislation passed the Senate earlier Sept. 30 and was signed by President Joe Biden.

headline: Transport Topics Radio
description: Transport Topics Radio is a weekly news roundtable airing Saturdays on SiriusXM channel 146 from 1-3 p.m. ET and rebroadcast Saturday nights from 11 p.m.-1 a.m. ET, and Sundays from noon-2 p.m. ET and 9-11 p.m. ET. Check out this week's lineup.

headline: Port Leaders Warn of Supply Chain Challenges as Holidays Near
description: AUSTIN, Texas — The leader of one of the nation’s busiest seaports said the next several months will severely challenge an already overtaxed supply chain, and the situation has reached a “crisis” level.

headline: Transportation Stakeholders Focus on Potential Legislative Changes
description: Federal lawmakers are working on numerous regulatory and legislative changes that could impact transportation, experts highlighted Sept. 29 at the Coyote Logistics Digital Summit.

headline: FMCSA Advised to Give Drivers 90 Days to Replace Recalled CPAP Devices
description: A medical advisory board to the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration has recommended that medical examiners be permitted to offer truck drivers alternative treatment options to sleep apnea machines that are subject to a massive recall.

headline: Lordstown to Sell Ohio Plant to Foxconn in $280 Million Deal
description: Lordstown Motors Corp. agreed to partner with Foxconn Technology Group in a $280 million deal that has the startup selling its former General Motors Co. factory in Ohio to the Taiwanese company in exchange for cash and an equity investment.

headline: Lawmakers, Stakeholders Press for Port Infrastructure Funds
description: WASHINGTON — Funding included in a $3.5 trillion budget bill meant to improve conditions at the country’s commercial ports is backed by congressional transportation leaders, the Biden administration and industry stakeholders.

headline: New EV Charger Can Provide 62 Miles of Range in 3 Minutes
description: ABB Ltd. is preparing to roll out the first of its ultra-fast charging stations in a matter of weeks, providing enough power in less than three minutes to charge any electric car to drive 62 miles.

headline: Car Sales Drop as Chip Shortages Stymie Buyers
description: After sounding an optimistic note in the first half of the year as soaring car prices padded their profits, auto executives have become more resigned to supply chain headaches after recent COVID-19 outbreaks in Malaysia hampered semiconductor production.

headline: Capitol Cliffhanger: Federal Funding, Infrastructure Bill Decisions Due
description: WASHINGTON — His government overhaul plans at stake, President Joe Biden appeared unable to swiftly strike agreement with two wavering Democratic senators trying to trim back his potentially historic $3.5 trillion measure that will collapse without their support.

headline: What Q4 and Beyond Have in Store for Transportation
description: The outlook for transportation and logistics in the fourth quarter focuses on the lingering effects of the coronavirus pandemic as well as the impending shopping season.

headline: Soldiers Will Haul Fuel to Ease UK Crisis
description: LONDON — The British government’s reserve tanker fleet was being deployed Sept. 29 to help deliver gasoline to empty pumps across the U.K., and military drivers will begin operating tankers in the coming days to ease the country’s fuel supply crisis, a top official said.

headline: Navistar Launches Redesigned International MV Series
description: Navistar Inc. announced the launch of the redesigned International MV Series, calling it a reimagining of its Classes 6-7 vocational vehicle that focuses on increased maneuverability, visibility and safety.

headline: Trucking Defense Lawyers Confront Jury Attitudes About Fleets, Drivers
description: Legal experts and researchers say juries generally carry negative attitudes about corporate America — and the trucking industry specifically — into the courtroom, making motor carriers susceptible to strategies that plaintiff attorneys employ to steer jurors toward sky-high “nuclear” judgments...

headline: Walmart Stokes Hiring Rush With Plan to Add 150,000 Jobs
description: Walmart Inc. is expanding its hiring push with plans to recruit 150,000 store employees, adding to U.S. employers’ search for new workers as the busy holiday season approaches.

headline: Electric Vans Roll Off Line That Once Made Gas-Guzzling Hummers
description: When the first snub-nosed, electric van rolled off the assembly line Sept. 28 at the Electric Last Mile Solutions Inc. plant in Mishawaka, Ind., it was a proud moment for the company’s co-founder and CEO, Jim Taylor. The van, one in a run of 1,000 scheduled for this year, is among the first of its...

headline: Lordstown Motors may sell its plant to Taiwan’s Foxconn for $230M
description: Taiwan’s Foxconn would manufacture Lordstown Motors’ Endurance electric pickup truck under an agreement to buy the former GM assembly complex.

headline: Ransomware attack on Forward Air may have exposed sensitive employee data
description: Nine months after a ransomware attack on Forward Air, the company has notified current and former employees that sensitive personal information may have been exposed.

headline: Workhorse executive housecleaning continues with ouster of CFO and COO
description: New CEO continues remaking executive team, with the chief financial officer and chief operating officer departing.

headline: FreightWaves Classics: I-24 travels through four states; ends in the heart of “Freight Alley”
description: I-24 passes through four states and provides a good east-west drive. Read more in this FreightWaves Classics article.

headline: M&A activity staying hot across logistics industry
description: Pent-up demand is making its way to the surface in 2021; this year has seen an explosion in M&A; activity due to the large amount…

headline: ArcBest sees billions of dollars in opportunities with MoLo acquisition
description: ArcBest’s acquisition of truckload broker MoLo Solutions accompanies an announcement of strong third-quarter results for its LTL segment.

headline: Be prepared, attorneys say: More driver classification suits coming
description: A pair of lawyers tell a TCA audience that taking steps early can help in later litigation.

headline: Successful driver recruitment is multifaceted issue
description: Tenstreet partnered with FreightWaves to better understand why drivers leave carriers and what they look for in new roles. Almost 4,000 drivers responded to a…

headline: Pick your bottleneck: Ports, chassis, containers, labor
description: With disruptions likely to linger well into 2022, intermodal equipment provider DCLI sees the labor shortfall as the biggest hurdle in the supply chain.

headline: Report: Electric vehicle tax could revive Highway Trust Fund
description: An ATRI study shows how electric vehicles can be taxed to keep the Highway Trust Fund from going bankrupt.

headline: An edge on growth: One way small fleets stand to benefit from vax mandate
description: Could Biden's vax mandate enhance the competitive edge for small fleets? If the pandemic's past suggests anything about the near future, fleets of under 100 trucks have added roughly 176K units by this analysis, while larger businesses added just 25K.
image: https://img.overdriveonline.com/files/base/randallreilly/all/image/2021/09/Screenshot_2021_09_30_11.34.36.6155e77aaddd1.png?auto=format%2Ccompress&fit=crop&h=167&q=70&w=250

headline: Landstar owner-op poised for growth after winning new-KW giveaway
description: Texas-based hauler Mike Lamb said winning the truck came at a time when he was already considering adding a truck to his business. Also: 'Supply-led' freight matching; FMCSA extends another waiver; More time to weigh in on Washington state parking issues.
image: https://img.overdriveonline.com/files/base/randallreilly/all/image/2021/09/mike_lamb_landstar.6155e9fb9b456.png?auto=format%2Ccompress&fit=crop&h=167&q=70&w=250

headline: Bryan Smith bags the big prize from TCA/Overdrive
description: The Owner-Operator of the Year was named Tuesday, September 28, at a gala banquet concluding the TCA's Truckload 2021 annual convention. Trucker Bryan Smith takes home $25K among other prizes with the competition.
image: https://img.overdriveonline.com/files/base/randallreilly/all/image/2021/09/Bryan_Smith.615464b2512f8.png?auto=format%2Ccompress&fit=crop&h=167&q=70&w=250

headline: Partners in Business tip: Work to improve your credit
description: Do not wait around and accumulate more debt over long periods of time. Pay off what you owe as well as any penalty fees. Pay off debt to improve your business.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Fuel prices surge to nearly 7-year high
description: The modest price increase over the past week brought the national average diesel price to its highest mark since December 2014. Also: Volvo unveils first autonomous truck; Crete raising pay for owner-ops, company drivers.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Are owner-operators a legal landmine for fleets? Attorney weighs in
description: Recent court rulings cast doubt on the future of the owner-operator model in trucking. It may take a Supreme Court ruling to settle the dispute.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: FMCSA shuts down New York-based trucker after hit-and-run crash, DUI
description: Bobir M. Kholmurodov has been effectively shut down after he ran a red light in Michigan, hit a car and fled the scene before later being caught with a blood alcohol content of 0.17 – more than four times the legal limit for truck drivers.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Breaking Free: The history of the owner-operator in trucking
description: From fighting for freedom to haul in its early days to stressing smart business practices later, Overdrive has championed the owner-operator’s concerns. Here, a history of owner-op business, from 1960-2011, with a special request for you.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Tractor-trailers banned from section of I-95; safety issue cited
description: DelDot urges truckers to use I-495 as an alternate route.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: DOT asks for truckers' input on supply chain disruptions | I-10 closure upcoming
description: DOT will use information from the trucking industry to find solutions for the current supply chain problems in the country. Also: Apex Capital expands factoring service; Spot market: Volumes up, rates down; I-10 closure planned near Phoenix this weekend.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: FMCSA boss nominee Joshi weighs in on the COVID hours waiver, trucking oversight, port congestion, more
description: During a confirmation hearing Wednesday, Senators questioned how Meera Joshi would handle a number of issues, including supply chain efficiency, potential future HOS waivers, FMCSA’s oversight of new entrant motor carriers, port congestion and more.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Following distance management, work-life balance key to safety, success of five-time Owner-Operator of the Year finalist
description: Bryan Smith attributes much of his owner-operator success to partnering with a good company and keeping up with his equipment. Learn more about him here.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Partners in Business tip: Use overdraft protection
description: See if your bank offers any of these options that are much less costly than bouncing a check. Get all the information you need here on Overdrive.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Refresher on IFTA accounting for truck owner-operators, and effective fuel strategy
description: Gary Buchs charts the case of a client operator taken by surprise with his first quarterly IFTA report. Discussion yields an effective strategy -- to plan your fuel purchases based on the price you will pay for the fuel only, minus state taxes.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Nomination period open for Owner-Operator of the Year Contest
description: The 2021 Owner-Operator of the Year winner will receive $25,000, and two finalists will receive $2,500 each. Also: Washington state lawmakers seek feedback on truck parking; recalls from Daimler Trucks, Utility Trailer.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Trucking company owner, reality TV star sentenced for PPP loan fraud, Ponzi scheme
description: Maurice Fayne, who owned Flame Trucking and starred in a reality TV series, was sentenced to more than 17 years in prison. Also: Human smuggling attempt thwarted near Laredo; Rolling Strong supporting St. Christopher health programs.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Louisiana staged-accident fraud scheme up to 40 indictments, 27 guilty pleas
description: Two guilty pleas and seven new indictments were announced recently in the widespread staged-accident fraud scheme in New Orleans. Also: Transflo's new document tools; CloudTrucks' new brokerage opportunities; Aurora's autonomous Volvo unveiled.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==

headline: Owner-op average income hits record, topping $70K annualized
description: Where do you stack up? ATBS President Todd Amen previewed some of the business services firm's owner-operator operational and financial benchmarking data Tuesday, with an operator-focused call coming 9/16. Find income, cost, revenue highlights here.
image: data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==
